description: a(0) = 0; a(n) is obtained by incrementing each digit of a(n-1) by 2.
comments: In A061511-A061522, A061746-A061750 when the incremented digit exceeds 9 it is written as a 2-digit string. So 9+1 becomes the 2-digit string 10, etc.Every term > 10 is made up of only two different consecutive digits, the smaller of which occurs only as the least significant digit.
example: Following 32; 3+2 = 5 and 2+2 = 4, hence the next term is 54.
author: _Amarnath Murthy_, May 08 2001
extensions: More terms from Larry Reeves (larryr(AT)acm.org), May 11 2001
